<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Truncate from the beginning, not the end, if the specified name is too</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// long.  For one, this ensures that the resulting string is still null</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// terminated, but additionally the end of a long thread name will usually</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// be more unique than the beginning, since a common pattern is for similar</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// threads to share a common prefix.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that the name length includes the null terminator.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/sched&#95;setscheduler.2.html</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><Highlight kind="normal">  sched&#95;param priority;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For each of the above policies, param-&gt;sched&#95;priority must be 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><Highlight kind="normal">  priority.sched&#95;priority = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SCHED&#95;IDLE    for running very low priority background jobs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SCHED&#95;OTHER   the standard round-robin time-sharing policy;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> !pthread&#95;setschedparam(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><Highlight kind="normal">             pthread&#95;self(),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><Highlight kind="normal">             </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME: consider SCHED&#95;BATCH for Low</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><Highlight kind="normal">             Priority == ThreadPriority::Default ? SCHED&#95;OTHER : SCHED&#95;IDLE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><Highlight kind="normal">             &amp;priority)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><Highlight kind="normal">             ? SetThreadPriorityResult::SUCCESS</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// significant time to complete. Examples include indexing, backing up, or</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// minutes to complete. Examples include downloading a document or importing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Byte offset of the pointer to the Communications Vector Table (CVT) in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the Prefixed Save Area (PSA). The table entry is a 31-bit pointer and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// will be zero-extended to uintptr&#95;t.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><Highlight kind="normal">    FLCCVT = 16,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Byte offset of the pointer to the Common System Data Area (CSD) in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// CVT. The table entry is a 31-bit pointer and will be zero-extended to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// uintptr&#95;t.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><Highlight kind="normal">    CVTCSD = 660,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Byte offset to the number of live CPs in the LPAR, stored as a signed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 32-bit value in the table.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><Highlight kind="normal">    CSD&#95;NUMBER&#95;ONLINE&#95;STANDARD&#95;CPS = 264,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;PSA = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;CVT = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">reinterpret&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(</Highlight></CodeLine>
